title: Global communications are under attack — optical satellite networks can bolster them
summary: Recent alleged Houthi attacks on underwater communication cables illustrate the need for more resilient connectivity technology, such as optical ground station networks.

title: Mining helium-3 on the Moon has been talked about forever—now a company will try
summary: "There are so many investments that we could be making, but there are also Moonshots."

title: Satellite firms forge unlikely alliances to create seamless multi-orbit networks
summary: As market forces and security needs push for greater multi-orbit communications satellite constellations, collaborative models and partnerships are becoming increasingly common among operators vying to stay relevant.

title: FAA requests large funding increase for commercial space office
summary: The Federal Aviation Administration is requesting a major budget increase for its commercial space office to both keep up with growing launch demand and prepare for potential new regulatory roles.

title: First Kairos rocket explodes seconds after liftoff
summary: The first flight of privately developed Japanese rocket ended in a catastrophic failure seconds after liftoff March 12.

title: Third satellite-carrying transatlantic Beluga flight lands in Florida
summary: The Airbus-built Eutelsat 36D geostationary communications satellite landed in Sanford, Florida, March 11 ahead of a SpaceX Falcon 9 launch slated from the nearby Kennedy Space Center at the end of the month.

title: Launch roundup – Starship poised for third integrated test flight
summary: The focus of the week ahead is dominated, of course, by the much anticipated third test flight of Starship.
